com.exacttarget.etpushsdk

Class ET_GenericReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.ET_GenericReceiver

  • public class ET_GenericReceiver
extends BroadcastReceiver
    Push Notification Receiver, useful for catching all kinds of events and intents broadcast by Android.

    This receiver is used to capture Google Cloud Messaging events related to GCM lifecycle (register, unregister, pushes). This receiver will also capture Amazon Device Messaging events related to ADM lifecycle (register, unregister, pushes). It inherits from Broadcast Receiver instead of GCMBroadcastReceiver so it can coexist with other GCM handlers, as well as life outside of any specific packages.

    Extend this class and setup your customized class as a BroadcastReceiver in AndroidManifest.xml if you want to customize the received notifications. Otherwise, it can be used directly in AndroidManifest.xml. 

     
 <manifest ...>
   ...
   <application ...>
     ...
     <!-- ET Broadcast Receiver for handling Google/GCM push messages. You can use the ET_GenericReceiver directly, or extend it to customize notifications -->
     <receiver android:name="com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.ET_GenericReceiver" android:permission="com.google.android.c2dm.permission.SEND">
       <intent-filter>
         <action android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.intent.RECEIVE"/>
         <action android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.intent.REGISTRATION"/>

         <category android:name="com.exacttarget.demo.etsdkdemo"/>
       </intent-filter>
     </receiver>
     <!-- ET Broadcast Receiver for handling Amazon/ADM push messages. ADM requires it's own definition for this receiver.  You cannot combine this definition with the definition for Google/GCM. You can use the ET_GenericReceiver directly, or extend it to customize notifications -->
     <receiver android:name="com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.ET_GenericReceiver" android:permission="com.amazon.device.messaging.permission.SEND">
       <intent-filter>
         <action android:name="com.amazon.device.messaging.intent.RECEIVE"/>
         <action android:name="com.amazon.device.messaging.intent.REGISTRATION"/>

         <category android:name="com.exacttarget.demo.etsdkdemo"/>
       </intent-filter>
     </receiver>
     ...
   </application>
     ...
 </manifest>

      • setupLaunchPendingIntent

        protected PendingIntent setupLaunchPendingIntent(Context context,
                                     Intent launchIntent,
                                     boolean autoCancel)
        This method creates the Pending intent used when the notification is clicked. By default, a PendingIntent for a broadcast is created. It's handled by default by ETOpenReceiver.
        Parameters:
        context -
        launchIntent -
        autoCancel -
        Returns:
        PendingIntent

      • setupLaunchIntent

        protected Intent setupLaunchIntent(Context context,
                       Bundle payload)
        Override this method to custom-create the Intent that will be launched when the notification is clicked. Most of the time, calling ETPush.setNotificationAction(String) and ETPush.setNotificationActionUri(Uri), ETPush.setNotificationRecipientClass(Class), ETPush.setCloudPageRecipient(Class), or ETPush.setOpenDirectRecipient(Class) is sufficient.
        Parameters:
        context -
        payload - the data received in the notification
        Returns:
        Intent

      • setupNotificationBuilder

        protected NotificationCompat.Builder setupNotificationBuilder(Context context,
                                                  Bundle payload)
        Override this method if you want complete control over the notification that gets displayed. Return null from your Overridden method to not display any notification for a specific message.
        Parameters:
        context -
        payload - data received from the notification
        Returns:
        NotificationCompat.Builder
